alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Greenbrier County through 830 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Duo, or 7 miles east of Quinwood. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Locally heavy rainfall. Frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leonard... Duo... and Anjean. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
